required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Correlation Between Cycle Threshold (Ct) Values in COVID-19, Health Status and Laboratory Biomarkers in the Population of Medellin- Colombia Evaluated in a Specialized Laboratory.
clinical_study.official_title: Correlation Between Cycle Threshold (Ct) Values in RT-PCR - SARS-CoV-2, Health Status and Laboratory Biomarkers in the Population of Medellin- Colombia Evaluated in a Specialized Laboratory

collaborator.agency: Laboratorio departamental de salud publica de Antioquia

brief_summary.textblock: This study will evaluate the correlation between the symptomaticity, Ct value, laboratory biomarkers associated to COVID-19 and the disease progression in hospitalized patients and outpatients with SARS-CoV2 infection diagnosed by RT-PCR assay for nasopharyngeal swab specimens in a specialized laboratory at Medellin,Colombia.

detailed_description.textblock:
After being informed about the study, all patients giving written informed consent will undergo a serial of test related to COVID-19. Rh and blood type will be obtained using the Colombian ID card or official document.
All symptomatic and asymptomatic COVID19-positive patients will be evaluated for a period of 4 weeks at three different times of the study. In a single time, the mitochondrial DNA will be measured, and the variability in the CT value, hemogram, cytokine levels, ratio of CD4 + / CD8 + lymphocytes, levels of dehydrogenase lactate, ferritin and D-dimer, antibodies IgG and IgM, will be measured on day 5, day 14 and day 28. In addition, spike S protein sequencing and growing the virus in cell culture that meet specific criteria will be performed. A physician will do clinical follow up through the period of the study for each patient.

primary_outcome.measure: Clinical immune response among COVID-19 patients related to CT value of rRT-PCR SARS-Cov-2
primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 4 months
primary_outcome.description: Calculated Ct value over 4 weeks, comparing the change in the immune status through the measurement of biomarkers

secondary_outcome.measure: Determine the duration of the positivity of the PCR test in asymptomatic and symptomatic patients through the follow-up
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 4 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluate differences in the titers of immunoglobulins M and G against anti-RBD domain of the protein S in SARS-CoV2
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 4 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Capacity of isolating the virus in cell culture with Ct> 32 by PCR in COVID-19 patients
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 4 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Identification of polymorphic variants or mutations in COVID-19 patients
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 4 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Mitochondrial DNA haplogroup relation in people infected with SARS CoV2
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 4 months

arm_group.description: 60 patients without COVID-19 symptoms related at the time of diagnosis.
60 patients with COVID-19 symptoms related at the time of diagnosis.

intervention.description: Study of the SARS-COV-2 antibodies of COVID-19 IgM ( day 5th and 14th) and IgG ( day 14th and 28th)
Real time RT-PCR for COVID-19 diagnosis at day 5th,14th and 28th
Laboratory data measure at day 5th,14th and 28th: Hemogram, cytokine levels, ratio of CD4 + / CD8 + lymphocytes, and levels of dehydrogenase lactate, ferritin, D-dimer.
One time quantification mitochondrial DNA haplogroup.
Probability of isolating SARS-Cov-2 in cell culture related to CT value above 32.
Sequencing viral protein spike (S) COVID-19 related to CT value below 15.

study_pop.textblock: COVID-19 confirmed patients with SARS-Cov-2 RT-PCR in Laboratorio Integrado de Medicina Especializada (LIME) or IPS Universitaria Clinica Leon XIII

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- People under 18 years old.
- Covid-19 diagnosis in the last seven days.
- Specimen analyzed at LIME laboratory
- Description of symptoms related to COVID-19
Exclusion Criteria:
- Immunocompromised patients
- Immunosuppressive treatments, chemotherapy or antiretroviral therapy
- Outpatient anticoagulation therapy
- Prior immunization for any vaccine in the last 3 months

overall_official.last_name: Andres F Zuluaga, MD, MSc, MeH

responsible_party.investigator_title: Full profesor, senior researcher and head of the Department of Pharmacology and Toxicology in Antioquia University
